item.title: Data Beyond Vision
item.author: Rebecca Sutton Koeser, Gissoo Doroudian, Nick Budak, Xinyi Li
item.description: How do we represent tangible objects in a visual medium? We use words, pictures, and diagrams. We describe, share, show, and fail.

item.title: Print a model of the Shakespeare and Company Lending Library Membership
item.author: Rebecca Sutton Koeser
item.description: Print a model of Shakespeare and Company lending library membership by date, as described in [Data Beyond Vision]. We invite you to participate in the embodiment and visible labor of data work. Download the following models and instructions, use your hands to recreate the data physicalizations we developed, or use them as inspiration to make your own interpretive objects. If you make any of these physicalizations, please share them on social media with the hashtag #DataBeyondVision.

item.title: Their Data, Ourselves: Illness as Information
item.author: Rebecca Munson
item.description: When I was growing up I liked to read about dying children. Iâ€™m not talking about the Victorian orphan kind of dying, not the dying of storybooks, but children who were terminally ill.

item.title: Weave Derrida's References
item.author: Gissoo Doroudian
item.description: Print a model of Shakespeare and Company lending library membership by date, as described in [Data Beyond Vision]. We invite you to participate in the embodiment and visible labor of data work. Download the following models and instructions, use your hands to recreate the data physicalizations we developed, or use them as inspiration to make your own interpretive objects. If you make any of these physicalizations, please share them on social media with the hashtag #DataBeyondVision.

item.title: About
item.description: <dl> <dt>startword, <abbr title="noun">n.</abbr></dt> <dd>(computer science) A string of letters that identifies the beginning of a valid sequence in a specified language.</dd> <dd>(literature) The first appearance of a genre in print.</dd> </dl>

item.title: Stack Shakespeare and Company Membership Activities
item.author: Xinyi Li, Rebecca Sutton Koeser
item.description: Create your own kirigami model of Shakespeare and Company lending library membership activities, as described in Data Beyond Vision. Tools Printer X-acto knife or other blade Bone folder or credit card Cutting matt or old magazines Supplies 4 Sheets of card stock paper (letter size is recommended, larger also works) Double-sided tape (optional) Steps Download the PDF Print on cardstock paper at actual size Cut along the vertical solid lines Fold along the horizontal dotted lines.

item.title: Weaving as interface
item.author: Rebecca Sutton Koeser, Gissoo Doroudian
item.description: deepzoom experiment -- body { background-color: black; } .highlight { /*border: 3px solid yellow;*/ } .highlight:hover { border: 3px solid yellow; } .pnum { text-decoration: none; color: white; font-size: 22pt; } /* .pnum::after { content: '1'; font-size: 22pt; display: block; color: white; } */ .reference { position: absolute; padding: 20px; left: 0; bottom: 0; width: 450px; height: 350px; background-color: white; z-index: 3; opacity: 0; -webkit-transition: opacity 1.
